AppIntroductionPage.1: Welcome! The Breastfeeding Coach app was created to assist you in the challenging journey of breastfeeding a baby born prematurely.
AppIntroductionPage.2: Explore each icon and discover how the App makes for a great ally!
AppIntroductionPage.3: The more you use The BreastfeedingCoach app, the more resources you will have to breastfeed your preterm baby!
AppIntroductionPage.4: You'll record your daily advances and have access to exclusive content to instruct and motivate you!

BabyCupPage.Step1: Wake the baby, massage their feet and face. Ensure the baby isn't agitated due to hunger or other discomfort, as this makes the maneuver more difficult.
BabyCupPage.Step2: Place the baby in a sitting or semi-sitting position on your lap, with the head at a 90º angle with the neck.
BabyCupPage.Step3: Place the edge of the glass to the baby's bottom lip and let the breast milk touch the lip.
BabyCupPage.Step4: The baby will lick the milk and follow by swallowing. Be careful not to pour the milk into the baby's mouth.

BreastfeedingBenefitsPage.TitleBaby: Benefits of breastfeeding for the baby
BreastfeedingBenefitsPage.TitleMom: Benefits of breastfeeding for the mother

Page1.Title: Benefits of breastfeeding for mother and baby
Page1.Text1:
Breastfeeding helps in forming a bond from an early age.

Breast milk is the most complete food for a baby, in addition to offering many other advantages.

There is nothing better than feeding a baby only breastmilk for the first six months of their life, and then breastfeeding in combination with healthy foods for up to 2 years or more.

Page2.Text1: Breast milk helps defend the body from various diseases. The effect of vaccines is better in breastfed children, and breastfeeding decreases the risk of childhood cancer.

Page3.Text1: It favours the development of the face, mouth, and teeth.
Page3.Text2: Children breastfed for more than a year have larger intelligence coefficients (Iqs).

Page4.Text1: Protects against a number of diseases, infections, and problems like diarrhea and constipation.
Page4.Text2: Reduces the risk of having problems such as diabetes and high cholesterol.

Page5.Text1: Research shows that it reduces the risk of breast, ovarian, and bone cancer.

Page6.Text3: Uterine involution, that is, PROMOTESs the return of the uterus to its normal size.

BreastfeedingPage.Header: All you need to know about pumping breast milk

Item3.3: Breastfeeding understand the benefits and their importance [accessed on 30 Jul 2021].

Item4.2: Breastfeeding understand the benefits and their importance.
Item4.3: São Raimundo Nonato: SãoRaimundo.com; c2019 [cited 2021 Jul 30].

Item5.3: Donation of breast milk can be made in Guaçuí [accessed on July 30, 2021].

DiaryIntroductionPage.Text1: This is your DIARY! A space to record your progress and offer resources that can help you on this journey!
DiaryIntroductionPage.Text2: It will be very important that you access your diary every day and note information about yourself, your baby, and your milk production.

DistractionsPage.Header: You not only can but should think about other things besides the challenges of prematurity and breastfeeding. And, sometimes, you should think of NOTHING at all!

HowLongToBreastfeedPage.Header: How long should you pump milk?
HowLongToBreastfeedPage.Text1: While your baby is not yet
HowLongToBreastfeedPage.Text3: As long as the baby is not breastfeeding

HowToBreastfeedPage.Title: How to pump the milk?
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page1: Secure your hair. Wearing a shower cap or wet towel is recommended to prevent any hair or follicle contamination.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page2: Choose a clean and quiet place.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page3: Massage the breast with the tips of two fingers, starting from the region closest to the areola and going to the farthest from the breast, supporting it with the other hand.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page4: Massage the most painful areas longer.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page5: Place the tip of the fingers (thumb and indicator) above and below the areola, tightening the breast against the chest.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page6: Press on the breast with rhythmic movements as if trying to connect the tips of your fingers and thumb, but without sliding on the skin.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page7: Discard the first few drops and store the rest in the bottle.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page8: If you cannot store the breast milk immediately in the refrigerator, the milk can be kept in a cool place and used up to 6 hours after being collected.
HowToBreastfeedPage.Page9: In the refrigerator, breast milk can be safely stored for up to 12 hours, or frozen for up to 15 days. Before feeding the baby with the kept milk, heat it in a hot water bath.

IntroductionStatusFormPage.Text1:
How do you feel about your self-confidence to breastfeed?

For each of the following statements, please choose the answer that best describes your self-confidence in breastfeeding your baby.
IntroductionStatusFormPage.Text2: Please answer by selecting the number that is closest to how you feel. There are no right or wrong answers.

ManageExpectationsPage.Header:
Adjusting improbable expectations to be more realistic helps with resilience!
Click on "Swap", if you'd like to change the expectation. If you don't want to, click on "Keep expectation".
ManageExpectationsPage.PopUp: Congratulations on exchanging this unlikely expectation for a more realistic expectation! Come back tomorrow to shift other expectations.
ManageExpectationsPage.NewExpectation2: Do what I can with love
ManageExpectationsPage.OldExpectation3: Having a healthy, plump, and blushing baby
ManageExpectationsPage.NewExpectation3: Love my preemie as they are
ManageExpectationsPage.OldExpectation4: Fulfill all my baby's needs alone
ManageExpectationsPage.NewExpectation4: Do my part to help my baby
ManageExpectationsPage.OldExpectation5: Fulfill all my family's needs as I used to before
ManageExpectationsPage.NewExpectation5: Delegate tasks to other people who can also help my family
ManageExpectationsPage.OldExpectation6: Close myself off from others to preserve my energy
ManageExpectationsPage.NewExpectation6: Opening up with trustworthy people to preserve my mental health

MilkAdditionalInformationPage.Text1: When the baby is born and the placenta is removed, important changes take place in the body that help initiate milk production. Hormones are released by the brain and act on the breasts.
MilkAdditionalInformationPage.Text2: During this process, the breast lobes – which look like bunches of grapes and are located at the end of channels known as ducts – begin to produce and store breast milk.
MilkAdditionalInformationPage.Text3: As the baby suckles the breast, or as milk is withdrawn, the brain produces more and more of the hormone oxytocin.
MilkAdditionalInformationPage.Text4: Inside the breast, oxytocin is responsible for “squeezing” the lobes, which helps to push the milk more naturally through the ducts into the small bags called ampoules.
MilkAdditionalInformationPage.Text5: Oxytocin is most easily produced and released when a woman feels good, is calm and confident. It is also produced when you see the baby, you touch or smell them, or even when you think about them.
MilkAdditionalInformationPage.Text6: The more the milk is withdrawn (either by the baby's suckling, manually, or with a pump), the more the brain releases hormones to facilitate the production of milk.

NotWhatIExpectedPage.Header:
Premature birth:
This is not what I expected
NotWhatIExpectedPage.Text1: Premature birth is something that always affects the structure of the family. In general, the reality of a premature birth is nothing like what was dreamed of during pregnancy...
NotWhatIExpectedPage.Text2: There is nothing wrong with you if you are feeling a mixture of fear, frustration, insecurity, anxiety, stress...
NotWhatIExpectedPage.Text3: Be patient with yourself! Take a deep breath...pick someone to open up with and talk to about how you're feeling...and then accept your baby just the way they are. Decide to embrace this new situation!

PageTitles.2: Feeding your baby with a cup

PrematurePage.Header1: Premature birth: not what I expected
PrematurePage.Header2: Nice to meet you, I'm the "Preemie" baby
PrematurePage.Header4: A period of struggle, a lifetime of results

ResiliencePage.Header: Do you know what Resilience is?
ResiliencePage.Option2: 2. Seek social support and group connection
ResiliencePage.Option3: 3. Develop a positive way of thinking
ResiliencePage.Text: Scientists claim that it is possible to INCREASE RESILIENCE by adopting at least 4 favourable behaviours. Various App activities feature one or more of these powerful ingredients! Increase your strength, boost your resilience: choose where you want to start and enjoy all the content!

SignUpPage.Header: First, we require the following data in order for you to access our platform:

StatusFormPage.Intro: Para cada uma das afirmações a seguir, por favor, escolha a resposta que melhor descreve sua autoconfiança em amamentar seu bebê. Por favor, marque sua resposta circulando o número que melhor descreve como você se sente.  Não há respostas certas ou erradas.

Thank you for replying.
Your score is %{score}, which means your self-confidence is %{meaning}.
StatusFormPage.WhenMyBaby: Quando meu bebê estiver realmente pronto para mamar no peito:

1.Description: I can pump enough milk for my baby.

2.Description: I can deal with the fact that breast pumping and breastfeeding can be time consuming.

3.Description: I can successfully cope with the breastfeeding situation (pumping and actual breastfeeding) like I have with other challenging tasks.

4.Description: I can manage the breastfeeding situation to my satisfaction.

5.Description: I can keep wanting to breastfeed

6.Description: I can be satisfied with my breastfeeding experience.

7.Description: I can get help with breastfeeding if and/or when I need it.

8.Description: I will be able to determine when my baby needs to be fed.

9.Description: I will be able to ensure that my baby is properly latched on for the whole feeding.

10.Description: I will be able to determine that my baby is getting enough milk.

11.Description: I will be able to manage to breastfeed even if my baby is crying.

12.Description: I will be able to breastfeed my baby without using formula as a supplement.

13.Description: I will be able to comfortably breastfeed with my family members present.

14.Description: I will be able to finish feeding my baby on one breast before switching to the other breast.

15.Description: I will be able to breastfeed my baby for every feeding.

16.Description: I will be able to manage to keep up with my baby's breastfeeding demands.

17.Description: I will be able to tell when my baby is finished breastfeeding.

18.Description: I will be able to switch from mostly pumping to mostly or completely breastfeeding my baby.

Options.3: About half the time breastfeeding and half the time receiving supplement
Options.6: My baby is still not receiving formula or milk, only parenteral nutrition

Page1.Title: 6 steps for breastfeeding a premature baby
Page1.Text:
With a premature birth, it's common for the baby to not be able to latch to the breast at birth and for the baby to be hospitalized to receive some ongoing care.

Despite the challenges, know that breastfeeding a baby born prematurely is possible, and that it's worth every effort!

The following steps summarize the journey towards success in breastfeeding a premature baby.

Page2.Title: 1. Look for serenity
Page2.Text:
Premature birth: frustrated expectations, uncertainties, fear ... Who hopes for their baby to be born pre-term?
Recover from the shock, take a deep breath, let the new reality set in your head and your heart, and then embrace it!

Page3.Title: 2. Stimulate Milk Production
Page3.Text: While your baby is unable to latch to your breast, or while they aren't able to breastfeed sufficiently, you'll need to take up the task of ensuring you continue producing milk. To do this, you must pump every 3 hours at least.

Page4.Title: 3. Strengthen the bond
Page4.Text: Stay as long as possible in the neonatal unit, have as much skin-to-skin contact as possible, observe your baby, touch them, talk and sing to them... all of this will stimulate your body to produce more milk.

Page5.Title: 4. Be the protagonist
Page5.Text: Take care of your baby: Clean their little eyes and mouth, change their diapers, bathe them; watch them and learn about their behaviours and preferences. Only you can play your mother role!

Page6.Title: 5. Invest in a support network
Page6.Text: Seek the support of professionals (nurses, technicians, doctors, psychologists, social workers ...) and of people in your support network that do you good. Remember: You're not alone!

Page7.Title: 6. Keep the patience
Page7.Text: When your baby starts to breastfeed, don't forget that by being premature, they can be more tired, "softer", and may need more time until they can perform the task.

Adult.Title: Informed consent form – Mothers
Adult.Text2: We would like to invite you to participate in the research
Adult.Text3: "Coaching by App: an innovative approach to breastfeeding of premature babies"
Adult.Text4: , to be held at the University Hospital of Londrina (HU / UEL). The purpose of the research is to elaborate and validate an application (APP) via smartphone focused on mothers for the promotion of breastfeeding of premature babies.
Adult.Text5: Your participation is very important and it would be as follows: Mothers participating in the research will be divided into 2 groups that will receive assistance to succeed in breastfeeding their premature child. One group will receive the routine care of the healthcare service, and the other group, in addition to receiving routine care, will also use an smartphone App for supporting and offer instruction on breastfeeding. The definition of the group to which each mother will be random, through draw. During the survey, you will be asked to respond to a questionnaire about your personal data, and a scale to measure your self-confidence in the breastfeeding process. Regardless of the group that you be part, your breastfeeding process will be supported and accompanied all the time, and you will be contacted by phone at two moments after the baby's discharge, for follow-up.
Adult.Text6: In addition, a month after discharge, you can be invited to attend an interview on experiences during your premature child's breastfeeding process. Your perceptions will be valuable for a better understanding by health professionals and researchers regarding the process of breastfeeding a premature baby. In this case, you will be interviewed or at the premature clinic, or at home, or remotely, per video calls, according to your possibilities. The interviews will be recorded and subsequently transcribed in full, lasting approximately 40 minutes and a maximum of 1 hour.
Adult.Text7: The information will be treated with the absolute confidentiality and confidentiality in order to preserve your identity and it will be used only for the search purposes.
Adult.Text8: We clarify that your participation is totally voluntary, you can: refuse to participate, or even give up at any time, without this lead to any burden or damage to your person. We also emphasize that your information will be used only for the research purposes and will be treated with the absolute confidentiality and confidentiality in order to preserve your identity.
Adult.Text9: We ensure that you will not pay or will be remunerated by participation, however, if there are any expenses resulting from the research, these are the responsibility of the researcher.
Adult.Text10: The possible benefits of your participation in this research will be the contribution to the construction of an App that intends to benefit and facilitate the breastfeeding process by promoting the dissemination of knowledge and information on the breastfeeding among the mothers of premature babies.
Adult.Text11: As for the risks, which are minimal, they apply to time for the use of the App and reading, questionnaires response, and the interview. To minimize this factor you can use the App on the time you find it timely and still interrupt the interview at any time, resuming or not when you find it convenient. We will do the possible to assist it in every process if any discomfort occurs, clarifying it whenever necessary.
Adult.Text12: If you have questions or require more clarifications you can contact us:
Adult.Text13: Edilaine Giovanini Rossetto, PhD, (43) 98837-6610, Rua Gil de Abreu Souza, 1501, Condomínio Royal Park, Esperança, Londrina-PR, ediluizrossetto@gmail.com
Adult.Text14: Gabriela Ramos Ferreira Curan, MSc, RN, Nurse, (43) 99921-6607, Rua Reverendo João Batista Ribeiro Neto, 75, apto 1903 torre 1 – Gleba Palhano, Londrina, gcuran@uel.br
Adult.Text15: Louise Marina Silva Fontana, RN, (43) 99147-9194, Av. Garibaldi Deliberador, 99 – ap 77, Bloco Dom Pedro I, Jardim Claudia, Londrina-PR, louise.fontana@uel.br
Adult.Text16: Or look for the Research Ethics Committee Involving Human Beings from the State University of Londrina, situated next to the Labesc building - school laboratory, university campus, telephone 3371-5455, e-mail: cep268@uel.br.
Adult.Text17: This term should be filled in two ways of equal content, one of them being duly filled, signed and delivered to you.
Adult.Text21: I, %{name} have been properly enlightened about the research procedures, agreeing to participate voluntarily from the research described above.

Parent.Title: Free and Informed Consent Form - Responsible for minor mothers
Parent.Text2: We would like to invite the teenager under your responsibility to participate in the research
Parent.Text3: "Coaching by App: an innovative approach to breastfeeding of premature babies"
Parent.Text4: , to be held at the University Hospital at the State University of Londrina (HU / UEL). The purpose of the research is to elaborate and validate an application (APP) via smartphone (cellular) for mothers aiming at promoting maternal breastfeeding (AM) of premature babies.
Parent.Text5: The participation of the adolescent under your responsibility is very important and it would be as follows: the mothers participating in the research will be divided into 2 groups that will receive assistance to succeed in breastfeeding their premature child.
Parent.Text6: One group will receive the routine care of the maternity unit and the neonatal unit of the HU / UEL, and the other group, as well as receiving routine care, will also use an APP for monitoring and guidelines on AM. The choice of which group it will be part will be random, through draw.
Parent.Text7: During the survey, the teenager will be asked to respond to a questionnaire about his personal data, and to a scale to measure his confidence in the breastfeeding process.
Parent.Text8: Regardless of the group that is part, the breastfeeding process will be supported and accompanied all the time, and the adolescent will be contacted by phone at two moments after the baby's discharge, for follow-up of this follow-up.
Parent.Text9: In addition, after one month of discharge, she may be invited to participate in an interview about the experiences during the breastfeeding process of the premature child, and these perceptions will be valuable for a better understanding by health professionals and researchers in the area about the process of breastfeeding a premature baby.
Parent.Text10: The adolescents will be interviewed at the outpatient clinic for the follow up of the premature infant or at home, according to the possibilities of the interviewees. The interviews will be recorded and then transcribed in full, lasting approximately 40 minutes and a maximum of 1 hour.
Parent.Text11: The information will be treated with absolute secrecy and confidentiality in order to preserve your identity and will be used only for research purposes.
Parent.Text12: We clarify that the participation of the adolescent under her responsibility is totally voluntary, and may request the refusal or withdrawal of participation at any time, without this causing any burden or injury to you.
Parent.Text13: We assure you that you will not pay or be remunerated for participation, however, if there are any expenses arising from the research, these are the responsibility of the researcher.
Parent.Text14: The possible benefits of their authorization to participate in this research will be the contribution to the construction of an App that intends to benefit and facilitate the breastfeeding process, promoting the dissemination of knowledge and information about breastfeeding among mothers of premature babies.
Parent.Text15: As for the risks, which are minimal, they apply to the time allocated to the use of the App, reading and responding to the questionnaires, and to conducting the interview. To minimize this factor she can use the App at the time she finds it appropriate and still interrupt the interview at any time, resuming or not when she finds it convenient. We will do our best to assist you in any process in case any discomfort occurs, clarifying it whenever necessary.
Parent.Text16: We inform you that this research meets and respects the rights provided for in the Statute of the Child and Adolescent - ECA, Federal Law No. 8069 of July 13, 1990, being them: to life, health, food, education, sport, leisure, professionalization, culture, dignity, respect, freedom and family and community coexistence. We also guarantee that Article 18 of the ECA will be met: "It is everyone's duty to ensure the dignity of the child and adolescent, making them safe from any inhuman, violent, terrifying, vexatious or embarrassing treatment."
Parent.Text17: If you have any questions or need further clarification, you can contact us:
Parent.Text18: Edilaine Giovanini Rossetto, RN, PhD, (43) 98837-6610, Rua Gil de Abreu Souza, 1501, Condomínio Royal Park, Esperança, Londrina-PR, ediluizrossetto@gmail.com
Parent.Text19: Gabriela Ramos Ferreira Curan, RN, MsC, (43) 99921-6607, Rua Reverendo João Batista Ribeiro Neto, 75, apto 1903 torre 1 – Gleba Palhano, Londrina, gcuran@uel.br
Parent.Text20: Louise Marina Silva Fontana, RN, (43) 99147-9194, Av. Garibaldi Deliberador, 99 – ap 77, Bloco Dom Pedro I, Jardim Claudia, Londrina-PR, louise fontana@uel.br
Parent.Text21: Or look for the Ethics Committee on Research Involving Human Beings of the State University of Londrina, located next to the building of LABESC – Laboratório Escola, on the University Campus, telephone 3371-5455, e-mail: cep268@uel.br.
Parent.Text22: Or look for the Ethics Committee on Research Involving Human Beings of the State University of Londrina, located next to the building of LABESC – Laboratório Escola, on the University Campus, telephone 3371-5455, e-mail: cep268@uel.br.
Parent.Text26: I, having been duly informed about the research procedures, agree with the voluntary participation of the child or adolescent under my responsibility in the research described above.

Minor.Title: Term of Assent - Mothers
Minor.Text2: We would like to invite you to participate in the survey
Minor.Text3: Coaching via App: an innovative approach to breastfeeding premature baby"
Minor.Text4: , to be held at Hospital xxxxx. The objective of the research is to develop and validate an application (App) via smartphone (cellular) for the promotion of breastfeeding (BF) of premature babies, aimed at mothers.
Minor.Text5: Your participation is very important and it would happen as follows: the mothers participating in the research will be divided into 2 groups that will receive assistance to successfully breastfeed their premature child. One group will receive routine care, and the other group, in addition to receiving routine care, will use an App for monitoring and guidance on BF.
Minor.Text6: The definition of which group you will be part of will be random, through a draw. During the survey, you will be asked to answer a questionnaire about your personal data, and a scale to measure your confidence in the breastfeeding process.
Minor.Text7: Regardless of the group that is part of, the breastfeeding process will be supported and monitored at all times, and the teenager will be contacted by phone two times after the baby's hospital discharge, to follow up on this follow-up.
Minor.Text8: In addition, you may be invited to participate in an interview about the experiences during the breastfeeding process of the premature child, and these insights will be valuable for a better understanding by health professionals and researchers in the area respect of the process of breastfeeding a premature baby.
Minor.Text9: You can be interviewed at the preterm follow-up clinic, at home, or remotely, depending on your possibilities. The interviews will be recorded and later transcribed in full, lasting approximately 40 minutes and a maximum of 1 hour.
Minor.Text10: The information will be treated with the utmost secrecy and confidentiality, in order to preserve your identity and will only be used for research purposes.
Minor.Text11: We clarify that your participation is completely voluntary, and you can: refuse to participate, or even give up at any time, without this entailing any burden or harm to you.
Minor.Text12: We ensure that you will not pay or be remunerated for participation, however, if there are any expenses arising from the research, these are the responsibility of the researcher.
Minor.Text13: The possible benefits of your participation in this research will be the contribution to the construction of an App that is intended to benefit and facilitate the breastfeeding process, promoting the dissemination of knowledge and information about breastfeeding among mothers of premature babies.
Minor.Text14: As for the risks, which are minimal, they apply to the time spent using the App, reading and answering the questionnaires, and conducting the interview. To minimize this factor, you can use the App at the time you see fit and still interrupt the interview at any time, resuming or not when you see fit. ThePrematurePage.Option1: Video "Pleased to meet you, I'm the "Preemie" baby"

UploadBabyPhotoPage.SelectPhoto: Choose a photo of your baby(ies) from the gallery and upload it here to remind you of your biggest motivation to breastfeed.

UploadFatherPhotoPage.Text: Involving the baby's second parent in this journey makes all the difference! Click on the button below and upload a photo of a cute moment between daddy and baby.If it's not possible to involve the baby's father, you can choose another important person to be that fundamental support for you and your baby!

UploadMotherPhotoPage.BestMother: YOU are the best mom in the world for your baby! Simply because YOU gave them life, which no one else could! YOUR BREAST MILK is the best food your baby can get!
UploadMotherPhotoPage.Mirror: Mirror, mirror on the wall... who's the most capable of breastfeeding of all?Click on the button below and upload a picture of yourself!

WhenToBreastfeedPage.Text3: that you need to produce milk for the baby, remember? So, the withdrawal of milk must be regular, occurring at least
WhenToBreastfeedPage.Text5: so that the breasts are always empty.

WhyBreastfeedPage.Header: Why should I pump my breast milk?

Page1.Text1: Remember those countless benefits of breast milk for premature babies?
Page1.Text2: Frequent milk withdrawal is how you
Page1.Text3: can prevent milk production from ceasing

Page2.Text1: Milk "stuck" in the breast leads the body to understand that it doesn't need to produce more!

Page3.Text2: the more you empty your breast, extracting the milk
Page3.Text3: , the more it produces! Because your body "understands" that milk is continuously needed! [1]

Yup.InvalidPassword: Must have lowercase letters, uppercase letters and numbers
Yup.MaxEqualError: Must be less than or equal to %{num}
Yup.MinEqualError: Must be greater than or equal to %{num}
Yup.NoOptionSelectedError: At least one option must be selected
